summary: This is a Federal Bureau of Prisons Program Statement (5270.09) establishing the Inmate Discipline Program, effective August 1, 2011. It outlines prohibited acts, sanctions, and procedures for disciplining inmates in BOP custody. The document includes significant changes such as establishing new prohibited acts for sexual assault with and without force, increasing severity levels for escapes and alcohol offenses, and introducing monetary fines as a sanction.

persons.name: Thomas R. Kane
persons.role: Acting Director, Federal Bureau of Prisons
persons.context: Approved the Program Statement as the Acting Director of the Federal Bureau of Prisons.

events.title: Inmate Discipline Program Effective Date
events.description: The Federal Bureau of Prisons Program Statement 5270.09, Inmate Discipline Program, becomes effective.

events.title: Program Statement Issued
events.description: Program Statement 5270.09 is issued, establishing the Inmate Discipline Program with updated prohibited acts and sanctions.

keyFacts: Establishes new Greatest severity level prohibited act (Code 114) for sexual assault involving force or threat of force, and a High severity level act (Code 229) for sexual assault without force.
Increases the severity level of escapes from non-secure facilities to Greatest severity and increases all alcohol-related offenses to Greatest severity.
Introduces a new sanction of monetary fine, with amounts based on severity level (up to $500 for Greatest severity).
Removes the formal sanctions of reprimand and warning, and increases the maximum disciplinary segregation sanction range from 7-60 days to 1-18 months.
Clarifies that possession of a cellular telephone or other electronic communications device is a Greatest severity level prohibited act.
